com.badlogic.gdx.ai.fsm

Class DefaultStateMachine<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ai.fsm.DefaultStateMachine<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - is the type of the entity handled by this state machine
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateMachine<E>, Telegraph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StackStateMachine

    public class DefaultStateMachine<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements StateMachine<E>
    Default implementation of the StateMachine interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected State<E> currentState
      The current state the owner is in.
      protected State<E> globalState
      The global state of the owner.
      protected E owner
      The entity that owns this state machine.
      protected State<E> previousState
      The last state the owner was in.

      Creates a DefaultStateMachine for the specified owner and initial state.
      DefaultStateMachine(E owner, State<E> initialState, State<E> globalState)
      Creates a DefaultStateMachine for the specified owner, initial state and global state.

    • Field Detail

      • owner

        protected E owner
        The entity that owns this state machine.

      • currentState

        protected State<E> currentState
        The current state the owner is in.

      • previousState

        protected State<E> previousState
        The last state the owner was in.

      • globalState

        protected State<E> globalState
        The global state of the owner. Its logic is called every time the FSM is updated.

      • getGlobalState

        public State<E> getGlobalState()
        Description copied from interface: StateMachine
        Returns the global state of this state machine.

        Implementation classes should invoke the update method of the global state every time the FSM is updated. Also, they should never invoke its enter and exit method.

        Specified by:
        getGlobalState in interface StateMachine<E>

      • getPreviousState

        public State<E> getPreviousState()
        Description copied from interface: StateMachine
        Returns the last state of this state machine.
        Specified by:
        getPreviousState in interface StateMachine<E>

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the state machine by invoking first the execute method of the global state (if any) then the execute method of the current state.
        Specified by:
        update in interface StateMachine<E>

      • changeState

        Parameters:

      • revertToPreviousState

        public boolean revertToPreviousState()
        Description copied from interface: StateMachine
        Change state back to the previous state.
        Specified by:
        revertToPreviousState in interface StateMachine<E>
        Returns:
        True in case there was a previous state that we were able to revert to. In case there is no previous state, no state change occurs and false will be returned.

      • isInState

        public boolean isInState(State<E> state)
        Indicates whether the state machine is in the given state.

        This implementation assumes states are singletons (typically an enum) so they are compared with the == operator instead of the equals method.

        Specified by:
        isInState in interface StateMachine<E>
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be compared with the current state
        Returns:
        true if the current state and the given state are the same object.

      • handleMessage

        public boolean handleMessage(Telegram telegram)
        Handles received telegrams. The telegram is first routed to the current state. If the current state does not deal with the message, it's routed to the global state's message handler.
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface StateMachine<E>
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface Telegraph
        Parameters:
        telegram - the received telegram
        Returns:
        true if telegram has been successfully handled; false otherwise.
